text: let's get hideout boy zester portal look
sorry my needle drops Anthony fan tanto
here Internet's busiest music nerd
haven't done a metal review in a while
gotta do a metal review guys zas Thurs
portal of sorrow zoster is a one-man
Californian black metal project whose
eight albums tall but his releases go
into the dozens when you count demos and
splits and EPS and all that other jazz
and portal of sorrow is alleged to be
the last album from the zas thor project
because malefic or scott conner rather
is closing the doors on it for good but
there are rumors around the internet and
on zas Thurs website of other projects
coming down the pipe now Jaster over the
course of his career has proven to be
just as harsh as any other black metal
artist out there the LP subliminal
genocide comes to mind but there's
always been a very prevalent atmospheric
some would say ambient style to his
music stuff that is really looking to
kind of alter your mood as opposed to
rock your face off stuff that's a lot
like Burzum or wolves in the throne room
leviathan not these more straightforward
black metal sounds that we're hearing
from new records by bands like Gorgoroth
or Arcanum and the ambient feels really
out in full force on portal of sorrow I
can really see why the guys in Sun have
given this project so much kudos that
have collaborated with Scott Connor in
the past despite the very low 5 airy
home recorded approach that zas Thor
takes on this record which isn't a
surprise in light of his other records
he comes up with some really interesting
sounds like the humming really distorted
guitars on this abyss holds the mirror
there are also some very beautiful
female vocals provided by Marissa Naylor
and Connor's vocals are just really
wretched and harsh but they have this
really surreal awkward at times
blurriness haziness to them kind of as
if they're buried underground my only
real complaint on the
our record is the drums and some of the
drumming the mixing on the drums kind of
makes them feel out of place in relation
to all the other instruments in a given
song and plus there are some moments
where the drums are just played pretty
badly I'm surprised Scott Conner didn't
do a couple second takes one of the
worst drum flubs on the entire LP is
right where it shouldn't be at the very
beginning of the album it was possibly
one of the worst LP starts I've ever
heard and it really made me question the
kind of music or at least the kind of
playing that I was going to be in for
for the duration of this LP and there
are a lot of moments like that for me
some of the bass is a little clumsy some
of the keyboard playing here and there
is behind tempo I know black metal isn't
about virtuosity however is it about not
caring not even a little bit just not
even giving us however I found the LP
actually got better as I trudged through
it the songs to me we're actually
getting more entertaining and I was
feeling a lot of the Bleak desperate
emotions that zas there injects into
this music I suppose a few gripes about
this LP that are not just mine that I
feel like a lot of people are going to
have the keyboards do sound a little bit
cheesy
especially the synthesized horns and the
synthesized strings they didn't really
bother me
I thought the sounds were okay plus I'm
kind of used to that sound from
listening to black metal didn't really
disappoint but I can see the keyboards
getting in the way of enjoyment for a
lot of people I think my major gripe
about this album is that a lot of the
songs just kind of meander structurally
they just kind of harp on one idea and
just drag it out and drag it out
thankfully zas they're kind of ends each
track before a given idea gets so boring
that you don't want to hear it anymore
however it's kind of hard to take one
song out of this entire LP and say ah
this is self-contained this is a good
track that I can show you here's a great
Jaster track that's not really how this
album and how most of zas their albums
work each track kind of feels like it's
part of this bigger picture of this
thing that really should be listened
through in one sitting
however there's not really any kind of
rhyme or reason at least to me anyway
as to how these songs link together or
if they're linked together at all
because they certainly don't fade into
one another that's for sure though I
enjoy the black metal sound and this LP
certainly has that sound and 2009's all
reflections drained
I feel like this new LP is superior to
that one in terms of color variation
production clarity this new LP
definitely has better sounds than that
last one however structurally
melodically and conceptually I still
found this new album very very
underwhelming very underwhelming I know
there are some zas their fans subscribed
to me some people who have heard this
album what do you think about it love it
hate it and why and also was this a good
end to the project or was it pretty much
mad
let me know Anthony fantana's Astor
portal of sorrow forever
